summary: An FBI New York electronic communication requesting assistance to pick up a pair of boots as evidence from a victim/witness in the Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell child sex trafficking investigation. The document provides a synopsis of the case, noting Epstein's 2019 arrest and Maxwell's 2020 arrest and upcoming 2021 trial.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the FBI's investigation for sexual exploitation and abuse of minors. He was charged and arrested with sex trafficking and conspiracy in July 2019.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as a co-conspirator who assisted, facilitated, and contributed to Epstein's abuse of minors by recruiting, grooming, and abusing them. She was charged and arrested in July 2020, with a superseding indictment in March 2021 and a trial set for fall 2021.

connections.description: Maxwell is identified as a co-conspirator who assisted, facilitated, and contributed to Epstein's abuse of minors.

events.title: Epstein Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was charged and arrested with sex trafficking and conspiracy.

events.title: Maxwell Arrest
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged and arrested with enticement of a minor, transportation of a minor, conspiracy to entice a minor, conspiracy to transport a minor, and perjury.

events.title: Maxwell Superseding Indictment
events.description: A superseding indictment charged Ghislaine Maxwell with sex trafficking of a minor and conspiracy.

events.title: Evidence Collection Request
events.description: FBI New York requests assistance to pick up a pair of boots as evidence from a victim/witness.

events.title: Maxwell Trial Scheduled
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's trial is set for the fall of 2021.

keyFacts: The FBI is actively collecting physical evidence (a pair of boots) from a victim/witness in the Epstein/Maxwell case as of May 2021.
The document confirms the ongoing investigation into co-conspirators beyond Jeffrey Epstein, specifically naming Ghislaine Maxwell.
Maxwell's charges were expanded in a March 2021 superseding indictment to include sex trafficking of a minor and conspiracy.
The victim/witness's identity and address are redacted/unclassified in the released document.
The investigation is a coordinated effort between FBI New York and the Southern District of New York's United States Attorney's Office.
